Summary

DM instance that illustrates USP events.

Event:1.0 Data Model

Name Type Write Description Object Default Version
Device. object - The top-level object for a Device. - 1.0
Device.LocalAgent. object - This object contains general information about the USP Agent itself... - 1.0
ControllerNumberOfEntries unsignedInt - The number of entries in the Controller table. - 1.0
Device.LocalAgent.Controller.{i}. object W Each instance of this table represents a USP Controller that has access to this USP Agent... - 1.0
BootParameterNumberOfEntries unsignedInt - The number of entries in the BootParameter table. - 1.0
Boot! event - Boot event configured via the BootParameter table and maybe requested via a USP operation. - 1.0
⇒ CommandKey string - The command_key supplied when requesting the boot, or an empty string if the boot was not requested via a USP operation. - 1.0
⇒ Cause string -

The cause of the boot. Enumeration of:

  • LocalReboot
  • RemoteReboot
  • LocalFactoryReset
  • RemoteFactoryReset
- 1.0
⇒ Parameter.{i}. object -

Boot parameters configured via the BootParameter table.

At most one entry in this table can exist with a given value for Path.

 - 1.0
⇒ Path string - Full parameter path. - 1.0
⇒ Value string - Parameter value (as a string). - 1.0
PeriodicNotifInterval unsignedInt­[1:] W ...the duration in seconds of the interval... - 1.0
PeriodicNotifTime dateTime W ...determine when the USP Agent will issue a Periodic Notification... - 1.0
Periodic! event - Periodic event configured via the PeriodicNotifInterval and PeriodicNotifTime parameters. - 1.0
Timer! event - Timer event requested via a USP operation. - 1.0
⇒ CommandKey string - The command_key supplied when requesting the timer event. - 1.0
TransferComplete! event -

Transfer complete event for tranfer maybe requested via a USP operation.

XXX 1: Several arguments illustrate "parameter defaults". These haven't yet been discussed.

XXX 2: Several argument descriptions were taken from CWMP TransferComplete.

 - 1.0
⇒ CommandKey string - The command_key supplied when requesting the transfer, or an empty string if the transfer was not requested via a USP operation. <Empty> 1.0
⇒ TransferType string -

The type of transfer. Enumeration of:

  • Download
  • Upload
  • Install
  • Update
  • Uninstall (

XXX 3: An uninstall isn't really a "transfer".)

 "Download" 1.0
⇒ FileType string­(64) -

An integer followed by a space followed by the file type description. Only the following values are currently defined for the FileType argument:

  • 1 Firmware Upgrade Image
  • 2 Web Content
  • 3 Vendor Configuration File
  • 4 Tone File
  • 5 Ringer File

The following format is defined to allow the unique definition of vendor-specific file types:

  • "X <VENDOR> <Vendor-specific identifier>"

...

 "1 Firmware Upgrade Image" 1.0
⇒ TransferURL string­(1024) - The URL from or to which this transfer was performed, or an empty string if no such URL is available. <Empty> 1.0
⇒ StartTime dateTime - The date and time transfer was started in UTC... 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z 1.0
⇒ CompleteTime dateTime - The date and time the transfer was fully completed and applied in UTC... 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z 1.0
⇒ Requestor string -

ID of Controller that requested the transfer, or an empty string if no Controller requested it.

XXX 4: This is called operation_source in the protobuf schema.

 <Empty> 1.0
⇒ FaultCode unsignedInt -

The numerical fault code as defined in...

XXX 5: This is what it's called in CWMP TransferComplete. It's called xfer_err.err_code in the protobuf schema.

 0 1.0
⇒ FaultString string­(256) -

A human-readable text description of the fault. This field SHOULD be an empty string if the FaultCode equals 0 (zero).

XXX 6: This is what it's called in CWMP TransferComplete. It's called xfer_err.err_msg in the protobuf schema.

 <Empty> 1.0
WakeUp! event - Wake-up event. - 1.0

Enable boolean W Enables or disables this BootParameter. - 1.0

A pattern that describes the Parameter(s) to be included in the Boot! Event...

Profile Definitions

Notation

The following abbreviations are used to specify profile requirements:

Abbreviation Description
R Read support is REQUIRED.
W Both Read and Write support is REQUIRED. This MUST NOT be specified for a parameter that is defined as read-only.
P The object is REQUIRED to be present.
C Creation and deletion of instances of the object via AddObject and DeleteObject is REQUIRED.
A Creation of instances of the object via AddObject is REQUIRED, but deletion is not REQUIRED.
D Deletion of instances of the object via DeleteObject is REQUIRED, but creation is not REQUIRED.

Core:1 Profile

This table defines the Core:1 profile for the Event:1 data model. The minimum REQUIRED version for this profile is Event:1.0.

Core data model objects, parameters and events that MUST be supported by all Agents.

Name Requirement
Device.­LocalAgent.­Controller.­{i}. P
Boot! -
Periodic! -
Timer! -
TransferComplete! -
WakeUp! -
